issues.description: The template’s Stock class provides a method named addItem(StockIngredient) but the problem statement’s UML and the solution implementation expect a method named addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient). Students following the specification will try to call addToStockIngredients but will find only addItem (and no addToStockIngredients), causing compilation errors.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template’s addItem method to addToStockIngredients (or add a forwarding addToStockIngredients method) so it matches the UML and the solution’s usage.

issues.description: The Stock class method for adding a StockIngredient is named addToStockIngredients in the problem specification and solution, but the template uses addItem, causing confusion when mapping the UML diagram to the starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template method addItem(StockIngredient) to addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) so it matches the problem statement diagram and the solution implementation.
